instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message: no liquide damage, just customer used magsafe 45W, no power from charger and battery <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present 3.41V and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.6V tried magsafe 60w same pb already checked <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 17/18 and 27/28, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.3v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.6V resistance to gnd on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and [B]<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> short to gnd 0 ohm short to gnd <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_R_N</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P_N</SIGNAL>[/B]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message: I don't understand what you are saying about [B]<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_R_N</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P_N</SIGNAL>, [/B]but if there is a 0 ohm short to ground on F7140, time to remove F7140 and see which side the short circuit is on. If it is on pin 2, something is wrong with the system side, if it is on pin 1, something is wrong with the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> side. If the issue is on the system side I would begin by checking resistance between pin 2 of F7140 and the CPU coils, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> coils, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> coil, and so on, and if no short is present there then inject 1v to see what gets hot and find the short.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message:
short on pin 2 of F7140

51 ohm cpu coils to pin 2 of F7140

3.75 kohms <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> coils to pin 2 F7140

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 30k ohms coil to pin 2 of F7140

inject 1v to pin 2 of F7140 nothing hot

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message: Inject voltage and monitor current. At 2 amps something must get hot. This bus is normally 12V so you can go a lot higher.

no short to gnd pin of <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>

inject 3V, current 0.24a find smc hot replaced now i've green light / orange light and no fan spin not power on

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message:
I don't get your logic. You say this was not water damaged so why check <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>?

If this really "just" happened it would have been because of a garbage Chinese charger and 3V42 spiking or something. An issue with PPVRTC/clock chip is more likely then.

You could check for power cycling on the S0 rails

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message: Where did I say CPU Vcore is never shorted? It is common to have a low value of 2 Ohms there and that is then mistaken for a short.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS low no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> only will go high if the correct or higher wattage charger is connected. So this board works now?

I hope you bought a 85W charger as this is the only one you need for testing.
